Tips for prospective students
In three sentences
Comments

The campus is located in the heart of downtown Chattanooga and is perfectly safe. In addition it is also adjacent to the biggest hospital in the area, and the only level one trauma within one hundred miles.

As a member of the Honors Program I come into contact often with both fraternities and sororities. There are plenty of both on campus and they are all outstanding. You'll certainly find something to suit your tastes.
There are a wide variety of clubs to enjoy on campus, from biology based science clubs to weekly movie clubs.
Anybody would benefit from their experiences here at UTC.
A Civil War cemetery is on the campus. In addition many world famous Civil War locations are nearby in addition to several national tourist attractions.
You'll certainly feel you've gotten your moneys worth here.
Chattanooga is a wonderful town to go to school in. There are tons of festivals, live music events, arts, and opportunities. Take full advantage of it when you come here!
There are a lot of options for food, you'll find something different and delicious every day!
I've always lived off campus, but I've been told that the on campus housing is fun, clean, and safe.
All of the professors I have encountered so far are excellent and take their job seriously.
Take your studies seriously and you'll go far.
The University of Tennessee is exciting, fair, and professional. I would recommend this university for any friends or family. In addition the University Honors Program is excellent.
pageTitle: The University of Tennessee-Chattanooga (UTC) Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {203498=Crossroads isn't as bad as everyone makes it seem. However, we're paying 1600 a semester for a meal plan and only get 450 max in mocs bucks which is a rip off., 284158=I visited this campus during the 2013 Fall Visit Day. The students and facility were warm and full of spirit, but the campus visit experience fell well short due to logistical issues. Visiting campus with several hundred other families, listening to speeches over a horrible public address system, being herded around the campus in large groups was not a positive experience., 359447=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 351207=I got accepted to UTC a few months ago and I cannot wait to attend! I will be a freshman in the Fall 2015 semester! Go Mocs!, 204406=Not very challenging compared to other schools. May be hard for students who had easy classes in high school., 2351=Chattanooga is a very beautiful place and the campus is small enough to pass at least someone you know everyday. Classes are medium in size and you can always get individual help from professors or tutors. The food is good ranging from Quiznos and Chik-fil-A to wraps, sushi and salads. The brand new gym is wonderful and the Aquatic center, once completed Fall 2010, will be decked out with a swimming pool, lazy river and water slide. There are plenty of clubs, intramurals, etc. to join and the musical performances are great. Plenty of things to do on and off campus with downtown within walking distance.}

textAfterTable: Am learning a lot I am a freshman at UTC this year and have learned so much already. Classes can be difficult or easy, it all depends on what the student would like to take. Taking challenging classes is great here, I can push myself to learn even more by doing this. There are plenty of opportunities to explore a wide variety of classes for those who are undecided through general education requirements. Login to rate or flag the reviews Marquef from Clarksville, TN 08/18/2009 Reviewer is A current student here. 8 out of 8 people found this review useful. 3 of 89 Categories Comments Great for these types of students If you like to meet new people but don't want be overcrowded, this is a good place for you. The campus is just the right size and it is close to all the downtown Chattanooga attractions so if you want to go to the aquarium, you just walk down the hill. Tips for prospective students
